dir-section.heading: National Organizations
dir-section.p: In May 2020 the Minister of Culture announced an investment of 12m. new leva in support of the sector in response to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, during which cultural institutions were subject to temporary restrictions on opening.

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: National Commission of the Republic of Bulgaria for UNESCO

address.verbatim-address: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 1040 Sofia, ul. Al. Zhendov 2

org-entry.content-note: hosts the Sofia International Film Festival; the largest exhibition and conference space in South-Eastern Europe

dir-section.heading: Cultural Heritage
dir-section.p: Bulgaria joined UNESCO in 1974, and has 10 cultural sites on the organizationâ€™s World Heritage List.

org-entry.content-note: attached to the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences

address.verbatim-address: 1000 Sofia, St Aleksandar Nevsky, bul. 19 February 1

org-entry.content-note: the Gallery comprises gallery space Kvadrat 500 (f. 2015); the Museum of Christian Art in the crypt of St Aleksandar Nevsky Cathedral; Museum of the Art from the Socialist Period; Sofia Arsenal-Museum of Contemporary Art; House Museums of Vera Nedkova, Nikola Tanev, Ivan Lazarov and Andrey Nikolov; and temporary exhibitions at The Palace
Bulgarian history from pre-history until the 21st century

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Pancho Vladigerov National Academy of Music

address.verbatim-address: 1505 Sofia, bul. Evlogi i Hristo Georgiev 94

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library

org-entry.content-note: largest public scientific library in Bulgaria
organizes annual World Workers' Sports Games `For Peace and Solidarityâ€™
mem. of the International Confederation for Workers' Sport since 1993
maintains archives of Bulgarian music, publishes music, reference books and compact discs, organizes concerts

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Union of Bulgarian Musicians and Dancers

address.verbatim-address: 1040 Sofia, ul. Makedoniya 1 Sgradata na KNSB, 16 etaj
